intro: Antheroporum, commonly known as the white thorn or white thornbush, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Fabaceae. It is characterized by its spiny stems and small, clustered flowers that typically range in color from white to pale yellow. The leaves are usually compound, consisting of several oval-shaped leaflets. Antheroporum species are native to various regions in Africa, Asia, and the Pacific Islands. These plants often thrive in dry, arid environments and are adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions.
